snippet: Sixty dump trucks’ worth of soil from the trade center site, identified as possibly holding human remains, has been sitting untouched beneath a tarp on Staten Island.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on revelation that 60 dump trucks’ worth of soil from the World Trade Center site, identified more than two years ago as possibly holding human remains from Sept 11 attack, have been sitting untouched under a tarp on Staten Island; startling possibility exists that remains of a large number of people will be found and identified in coming months, nearly 12 years after attack.
lead_paragraph: Sixty dump trucks’ worth of soil from the trade center site, identified as possibly holding human remains, has been sitting untouched beneath a tarp on Staten Island.

headline.seo: Finding, Searching and Waiting for Remains, 12 Years After 9/11
headline.main: 9/11 Remains Still Found, and Still Sought
